meanings.definition: A temporary leave of absence from work
meanings.sent1: During the furlough, the employee took time off to spend with family.
meanings.sent2: She requested a furlough to attend her sister's wedding.
meanings.sent3: The furlough gave him a break from the daily grind of work.
meanings.sent4: The furlough was like a mini-vacation in the middle of the week.
meanings.sent5: The furlough felt like a breath of fresh air in her busy schedule.

meanings.definition: To grant a leave of absence to someone
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to furlough the employee for personal reasons.
meanings.sent2: They will furlough him for a week to deal with his family emergency.
meanings.sent3: The company will furlough her to allow time for her studies.
meanings.sent4: The boss had to furlough him to handle the sudden workload.
meanings.sent5: They furloughed the team to give them a well-deserved break.

meanings.definition: To lay off or dismiss employees temporarily
meanings.sent1: The company had to furlough some staff due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent2: They will furlough a few employees until the project picks up.
meanings.sent3: The decision to furlough workers was a tough one for the management.
meanings.sent4: The company had to furlough workers to survive the economic downturn.
meanings.sent5: The furloughed employees hoped to return to work soon.
